page.title: 18The Forge
page.content: The Forge was built about 1770 and the Forge House used to be the whole building next door which is now 3 cottages. It is owned and run by Mr. Stern who works there with 4 other men. The Forge makes 8 different sizes of horseshoes and Mr. Stern mends spades and lots of other tools. There are 2 fireplaces where the metal is heated until it is soft and workable, 5 different sorts of hammers and 7 anvils, 3 of which are for the 3 vans. There are lots of different sizes of nails as well. On average they shoe 8 horses a day and horses usually need to be shod every 4 weeks. The charges are Â£22 for a Shire to be shod, Â£18 for a horse and Â£16 for a pony. Mr.Stern sometimes goes out to shoe horses but this costs more.
